description: The star pop singer caught up with 60 Minutes in her RV the morning after her headline performance and an all-night celebration.
title: Dua Lipa's all-night party at Glastonbury 2024

description: While reporting on the tensions between China and the Philippines in the South China Sea, 60 Minutes was on board as a Philippine ship was rammed — then surrounded — by larger Chinese vessels.
title: Rammed and surrounded by Chinese ships at sea

description: Dua Lipa knew she wanted to be a singer from a young age and spent years manifesting her path to pop success.
title: How Dua Lipa manifested her Glastonbury headlining dream, down to the day

description: At 15, Dua Lipa convinced her parents to let her pack her bags and move to another country so she could try to make it big. It paid off for the Grammy-winning pop star.
title: Dua Lipa's committed to her music, despite the "stigma around pop"

description: Chinese ships have repeatedly rammed Philippine ships in the South China Sea. The U.S. has a mutual defense treaty with the Philippines, which could lead to American intervention.
title: Why China rammed a Philippine ship while 60 Minutes was on board

description: The U.S. could be drawn into a conflict between China and the Philippines that's been roiling the South China Sea.
title: South China Sea conflict near Philippines could be next U.S.-China flashpoint

description: Jerod Hughes, a convicted Jan. 6 rioter who helped kick open a door to the Capitol, still believes the 2020 election was stolen.
title: Jan. 6 rioter who kicked open Capitol door regrets police interactions

description: The crimes of the Jan. 6 Capitol riot are some of the most recorded in history, top prosecutor Matthew Graves says. He explains what went into the more than 1,000 convictions.
title: Top prosecutor says Jan. 6 likely has "most recorded crimes in all of our history"

description: The Justice Department has convicted more than 1,000 Jan. 6 rioters. U.S. Attorney Matthew Graves says the crimes that occurred that day are likely some of the most recorded in history.
title: U.S. attorney explains Jan. 6 Capitol riot prosecutions

description: Next Sunday on 60 Minutes, the head of the Drug Enforcement Administration calls the fentanyl crisis the greatest threat we face as a country.
title: 60 Minutes investigates the fentanyl crisis as drug kills thousands each year

description: While reporting on the tensions between China and the Philippines in the South China Sea, 60 Minutes was on board as a Philippine ship was rammed — then surrounded — by larger Chinese vessels.

title: Dua Lipa: The 60 Minutes Interview

title: Jan. 6 Capitol riot prosecutions explained | 60 Minutes

title: U.S. could be drawn into clash between Philippines, China as tensions rise | 60 Minutes

description: The star pop singer caught up with 60 Minutes in her RV the morning after her headline performance and an all-night celebration.
title: Dua Lipa's all-night party at Glastonbury 2024

description: Authorities provided new details of what the FBI says "appears to be" another attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump on Sunday near his golf club in West Palm Beach, Florida. CBS News' Anna Schecter and Manuel Bojorquez have more on what we know so far, and retired FBI agent Tom O'Connor talks about what officials will be looking at during their investigation.
title: Suspect was pointing rifle toward Florida golf course where Trump was golfing, officials say

description: Donald Trump's running mate, JD Vance, released a statement on social media after the Secret Service engaged with a gunman who was seen pointing a high-powered rifle at the Florida golf course where the former president was golfing on Sunday. The suspect was later taken into custody. CBS News' Jake Rosen, Anna Schecter and Skyler Henry have the latest.
title: JD Vance says he's glad Trump is safe after shots fired at Florida golf club, suspect in custody

description: Gary Cohn served as former President Donald Trump's chief economic adviser from 2017-18 and served as director of the National Economic Council.
title: Gary Cohn warns tariffs could have inflationary impact if approach isn't "methodical"

description: Donald Trump was golfing at his golf club in West Palm Beach, Florida, when Secret Service agents engaged with a suspect pointing a high-powered rifle at the golf course, officials said. The suspect fled the scene but was later taken into custody. A.T. Smith, former deputy director of the U.S. Secret Service, and Tom O'Connor, a retired FBI agent, join CBS News with more analysis.
title: FBI leading investigation into "what appears to be" another Trump assassination attempt

description: The FBI is leading the investigation into what it said "appears to be an attempted assassination attempt" of former President Donald Trump on Sunday. Trump is "safe and unharmed" after Secret Service agents engaged with a suspect pointing a high-powered rifle at the golf course where the former president was golfing in West Palm Beach, Florida, officials said. Anna Schecter, who leads CBS News' crime and public safety unit, joins CBS News with more.
title: What we know so far about shots fired near Trump

description: Authorities provided an update after gunshots were fired in the vicinity of former President Donald Trump in West Palm Beach, Florida. A suspect who had a high-powered rifle near a golf course where Trump was playing is in custody. Watch their remarks.
title: Authorities provide update after shots fired in Trump's vicinity in Florida

description: A person with high powered rifle was seen pointing the gun toward a Florida golf course where former President Donald Trump was golfing, sources tell CBS News. Secret Service agents fired multiple shots at the suspect, who attempted to run. One person is in custody, the sources said. The Trump campaign says Trump is safe.
title: Person in custody after report of gunshots fired in vicinity of Trump, sources say

description: The 2024 Emmy Awards are on tonight. Find out who's hosting, who's nominated and how to watch without cable.
title: How to watch the 2024 Emmy Awards tonight

description: Heavy rains caused severe flooding in Central Europe, affecting countries like Austria, the Czech Republic, Poland, and Romania.
title: At least 8 dead, 4 missing amid heavy rain, flooding in Central Europe

description: The Secret Service said it is "investigating a protective incident involving former President Donald Trump that occurred shortly before 2 p.m."
title: Trump "safe," Secret Service engages suspect at Florida golf course, source say

description: Former President Donald Trump declared "I hate Taylor Swift!" in a Truth Social post Sunday, days after she endorsed Kamala Harris.
title: Donald Trump says "I hate Taylor Swift!"

description: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, GOP VP nominee Sen. JD Vance and Gary Cohn join Margaret Brennan.
title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 15, 2024

description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Republican vice-presidential nominee Sen. JD Vance of Ohio talks about his amplification of false claims about Haitian immigrants in his home state. Plus, former Trump economic adviser Gary Cohn talks about the former president's tariff plan.
title: 9/15: Face the Nation

description: Former President Donald Trump pledged this week to eliminate income taxes on overtime pay, which would require congressional approval.
title: "American workers should keep more of their own money," Vance says of Trump OT plan

description: The British Royal Family, including Prince William and Princess Kate, shared brief messages online acknowledging Prince Harry's 40th birthday.
title: Royal family shares birthday messages for Prince Harry's 40th

description: Missed the second half of the show? The latest on...Gary Cohn, who served as the head of the National Economic Council in the Trump administration, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that as the former president has proposed a new proposal for a 10% tariff on foreign imports, that if the U.S. starts "tariffing those products, we will have inflation", and as misinformation has been spreading online about voting in the 2024 presidential election, David Becker, Center of Election Innovation and Research executive director and CBS contributor, and Chris Krebs, former director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency and CBS News cybersecurity expert and analyst, share their predictions with "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan."
title: Face the Nation: Cohn, Krebs, Becker

description: Hosted by Jane Pauley. In our cover story, Dr. Jon LaPook talks with experts who warn about the rise of vaccine skepticism. Also: Jane Pauley visits veteran journalist Connie Chung, author of a new memoir, “Connie”; Erin Moriarty interviews Hillary Rodham Clinton about her new book, “Something Lost, Something Gained”; Tracy Smith profiles comedian Will Ferrell and former “Saturday Night Live” head writer Harper Steele, subjects of a new documentary, “Will & Harper”; Kelefa Sanneh interviews LL Cool J, who has returned to the world of music with his first album in more than a decade; David Pogue checks out new designs and initiatives being implemented to cut down on bird strikes; and Martha Teichner sits down with Pete Wells, who dishes on his 12 years as restaurant critic for The New York Times.
title: 9/15: Sunday Morning

description: Gary Cohn, who served as the head of the National Economic Council in the Trump administration, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that as the former president has proposed a new proposal for a 10% tariff on foreign imports, that if the U.S. starts "tariffing those products, we will have inflation."
title: Former Trump economic adviser says Trump's tariff plan would lead to rise in inflation

description: As misinformation has been spreading online about voting in the 2024 presidential election, David Becker, Center of Election Innovation and Research executive director and CBS contributor, and Chris Krebs, former director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency and CBS News cybersecurity expert and analyst, share their predictions with "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan."
title: "Listen to public officials," election experts say ahead of 2024 voting

description: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, a Democratic surrogate for the Harris-Walz campaign, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that the false claims about Haitian immigrants in Springfield, Ohio, contain a "remarkable amount of not just inaccuracies, but dog whistling."
title: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore says "remarkable" amount of "dog whistling" in false immigrant claims

description: Sen. JD Vance of Ohio, the Republican nominee for vice president, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" defended his spreading of false claims about Haitian immigrants in his home state. "You're never going to get this stuff perfect," he said.
title: JD Vance defends amplifying false claims about immigrants

description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Republican vice-presidential nominee Sen. JD Vance of Ohio talks about his amplification of false claims about Haitian immigrants in his home state. Plus, former Trump economic adviser Gary Cohn talks about the former president's tariff plan.
title: Open: This is "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 15, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Gary Cohn, former director of the U.S. National Economic Council, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 15, 2024.
title: Transcript: Gary Cohn, former director of the U.S. National Economic Council, on 'Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on Sept. 15, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with David Becker, Center of Election Innovation and Research executive director and CBS contributor, and Chris Krebs, former director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency and CBS News cybersecurity expert and analyst, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 15, 2024.
title: Transcript: David Becker and Chris Krebs on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 15, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, a Democrat, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 15, 2024.
title: Transcript: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 15, 2024

description: On "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sen. JD Vance condemned the threat of violence in Springfield, Ohio, despite amplifying the false claims.
title: JD Vance defends amplifying false claims about immigrants

description: We leave you this Sunday among wildflowers at the Buttercup Farm Audubon Sanctuary in the Hudson Valley of New York State. Videographer: Elijah Bhagat.
title: Nature: Wildflowers of New York State

description: Twenty-six years ago, CBS News' Harry Smith interviewed actress Meryl Streep, asking her the secret to her uncanny ability to inhabit every role she takes.
title: Flashback (1998): Meryl Streep

description: Comedy legend Will Ferrell and former "SNL" head writer Harper Steele had been buddies since the mid-1990s. Two years ago, Steele announced that she had transitioned to a woman. How they approached the changing dynamics of their friendship became the basis of a new Netflix documentary.
title: "Will & Harper": Will Ferrell embarks on a unique road trip with his best friend

description: Comedy legend Will Ferrell and former "Saturday Night Live" head writer Harper Steele had been buddies since the mid-1990s. Two years ago, Steele sent an email announcing that she had transitioned to a woman. How the two approached the changing dynamics of their friendship became the basis of a new Netflix documentary, "Will & Harper," in which the two embark on a cross-country road trip – 17 days of laughter, tears and beer. Correspondent Tracy Smith talks with Ferrell and Steele about their adventure and what they learned about themselves, and the nation they navigated.
title: "Will & Harper": Will Ferrell's unique road trip with his best friend

description: The veteran journalist broke down barriers in TV news to become the first Asian woman to co-anchor a nightly network news program. She reflects on her four-decade career in a new memoir, "Connie."
title: Connie Chung's secrets to her success: "Work hard, be brave, and take risks"

description: Veteran CBS journalist Connie Chung broke down barriers in TV news to become the first Asian woman to co-anchor a nightly network news program. She reflects on her four-decade career in a new memoir, "Connie," and sits down at her home in Montana with "Sunday Morning" anchor Jane Pauley, to talk about fighting sexism and racism in what she called "a sea of men," and the lengths she would go to, to land the big interviews.
title: Connie Chung's secrets to her success

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Republican vice-presidential nominee Sen. JD Vance, Republican of Ohio on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 15, 2024.
title: Transcript: Sen. JD Vance on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sep. 15, 2024

description: According to experts, up to a billion birds die every year from flying into buildings and skyscrapers – distracted by lights or reflections, or unaware of the hazards posed by glass. But some architects are using new bird-friendly glass in their construction, while public-awareness campaigns are having a dramatic effect on creating safer environments for migrating birds. Correspondent David Pogue reports.
title: New methods, designs aim to cut down on bird strikes

description: He became one of the first major hip-hop stars, with hits like "Going Back to Cali." He turned to acting, starring for 14 seasons on "NCIS: Los Angeles." Now 56, he's returned to the thing he loves most, with his first album in more than a decade, "The Force."
title: The return of LL Cool J, the rapper

description: As a teenager LL Cool J was the first artist signed to the Def Jam label, becoming one of the first major hip-hop stars, with hits like "Going Back to Cali" and "Mama Said Knock You Out." He turned to acting, starring for 14 seasons on "NCIS: Los Angeles." Now 56, he's returned to the thing he loves most – rapping – with his first album in more than a decade, "The Force." He talks with "Sunday Morning" contributor Kelefa Sanneh about the origins of his career, and the magic of making a hip-hop record.
title: The return of LL Cool J, the rapper

description: "Sunday Morning" remembers some of the notable figures who recently left us, including renowned stage and film actor James Earl Jones, who appeared on screen in "Field of Dreams," and "off screen" as the voice of Darth Vader in "Star Wars."
title: Passage: In memoriam

description: The former first lady, senator, secretary of state and presidential nominee opens up about personal matters in her new book, "Something Lost, Something Gained: Reflections on Life, Love, and Liberty."
title: Hillary Clinton on Harris' White House run, Trump's criminal conviction, and more

description: Hillary Rodham Clinton has lived one of the most public of lives, but has kept much private during her years as first lady, Senator, Secretary of State and presidential nominee. Now, she opens up about personal matters in her new book, "Something Lost, Something Gained: Reflections on Life, Love, and Liberty." She talks with CBS News' Erin Moriarty about her marriage to President Bill Clinton and the loss of friends and family; her personal association to Vice President Kamala Harris' run for the White House; and how she interpreted news of the criminal conviction of former President Donald Trump.
title: Hillary Clinton on Harris race, Trump conviction, and more

description: One of the world's most powerful restaurant critics, New York Times columnist Pete Wells filed his final review this summer. He reflects on dining out five nights a week for the past 12 years, all in the line of duty.
title: Pete Wells dishes on life as New York Times restaurant critic

description: Since he began writing restaurant reviews for The New York Times in 2012, Pete Wells became arguably the world's most powerful restaurant critic, until filing his final review this summer. With correspondent Martha Teichner, he reflects on dining out five nights a week for the past twelve years, all in the line of duty; the disguises he's worn to avoid detection by restaurant staff; and the health implications of eating at some of the world's best (and not-so-best) restaurants.
title: Pete Wells dishes on life as NY Times restaurant critic

description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at historical events on this date.
title: Almanac: September 15

description: Thanks to vaccinations, measles was declared eliminated in the U.S. in 2000. But measles cases are now back; one reason is that more families have exempted their children from routine immunizations than ever before.
title: Experts warn against vaccine skepticism

description: Thanks to vaccinations, measles was declared eliminated in the United States in 2000. But measles cases are now back, and one big reason is that, across the country, more families have exempted their children from routine immunizations than ever before. CBS News chief medical correspondent Dr. Jon LaPook looks at how the views of "anti-vaxxers" are precipitating new health crises; and talks with health experts about the dangers posed by anti-vaccine and anti-science movements.
title: As measles cases increase, experts warn against vaccine skepticism

description: Six people were taken to hospital "in relative emergency," including a 10-month-old baby with hypothermia.
title: At least 8 dead in English Channel migrant crossing, French authorities say

description: We’re exploring the variety of cuisines the Garden State has to offer, from a popular Livingston diner to a Bangladeshi restaurant in Jersey City run by a mother-daughter duo. Watch these stories and more on "The Dish."
title: The Dish: New Jersey restaurants

description: They wrote in a statement that if former Republican President Ronald Reagan was alive, he would back Vice President Kamala Harris' candidacy.
title: Ronald Reagan's former staff back Harris-Walz ticket

description: Splashdown northwest of Key West, Florida, closed out a mission highlighted by the first non-government civilian spacewalk.
title: Polaris Dawn crew splashes down to end record-setting commercial mission

description: Director Jon Chu sits down with Jo Ling Kent to discuss his ongoing career and his latest project, “Wicked,” which will be out later this year. Then, Serena Altschul visits the New York City Ballet to learn about the history of the renowned company celebrating 75 years of dance. Here Comes the Sun is a closer look at some of the people, places and things we bring you every week on “CBS Sunday Morning.”
title: Here Comes the Sun: Jon Chu and more
